data.event: It was founded in 1736 as the fortress of Buzulukskaya (Бузулу́кская) on the Samara River near the mouth of the Buzuluk River along Russia's southern frontier.
It was granted town status in 1781.

event.title: An important development was the opening, in 1877

data.event: An important development was the opening, in 1877, of the railway line connecting Samara with Orenburg.

event.title: other new infrastructure developments, it now

data.event: Supported by the rail link and other new infrastructure developments, it now became an important rail-terminal for the transportation of wheat.

event.title: doubled between the end of the nineteenth century and 1926

data.event: The population almost doubled between the end of the nineteenth century and 1926.
